text: Answer: 5. Solution: Let n = 6 then number of pigeons = 13 and number of holes = 6. Now we have one pigeon remained. We can put any hole. Let we put on 3+ hole: 4 N PS, P6j\P7, P8 |Po P1ofP [\ P13 S Then the largest value of sum of pigeons of two consecutive (i & i+1 (mod n)) holes =2 + 3= 5. So, the largest value of X =2 + 3 = 5.
